book_title: Doctor Who - The Day of the Doctor
author: Steven Moffat
text: The Doctor stood in front of the TARDIS, staring into the distance. Time and space had no boundaries.

book_title: Doctor Who - The Day of the Doctor
author: Steven Moffat
text: The TARDIS was more than a ship; it was a way of life. It could travel anywhere and everywhere.

book_title: Doctor Who - The Day of the Doctor
author: Steven Moffat
text: Zygons had invaded Earth once more, and only the Doctor could stop them. He needed help from old friends.

book_title: Doctor Who - The Day of the Doctor
author: Steven Moffat
text: Unit was prepared to battle the Zygons, but the Doctor's plan was far more complicated than they could comprehend.

book_title: Doctor Who - The Day of the Doctor
author: Steven Moffat
text: The Time Lords were returning, and the Doctor had to make the ultimate decision: to save Gallifrey or destroy it.
